name: Titanium.Gesture
summary: The Gesture module is responsible for high-level device gestures such as orientation changes and shake gestures.

events.name: orientationchange
events.description:
On Android, note that the application must have a heavyweight window or tab group open in order to receive the orientationchange event. It is not necessary for the heavyweight window to be the topmost window.

Almost all real-world applications will have a heavyweight window or a tab group. This is only likely to be an issue if you create a test case or test application that adds an orientation change listener from app.js without opening a heavyweight window.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: shake
events.description:
A shake gesture consists of a series of quick accelerations, and is represented by a series of shake events.

The timestamp property represents the interval between shake events. It is measured in milliseconds on Android, and in seconds on iOS.

properties.name: timestamp
properties.summary: Time interval since previous shake event. On iOS, this value is 0 for the first shake event in a series.

properties.name: x
properties.summary: Acceleration along the X axis, in Gs.

properties.name: y
properties.summary: Acceleration along the Y axis, in Gs.

properties.name: z
properties.summary: Acceleration along the Z axis, in Gs.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: landscape
properties.summary: Indicates if the device is currently held in landscape form.
properties.description: Value is true if in landscape, and false otherwise.

properties.name: orientation
properties.description:
Value may be one of the group of Titanium.UI orientation constants, PORTRAIT, UPSIDE_PORTRAIT, LANDSCAPE_LEFT, LANDSCAPE_RIGHT, FACE_UP, FACE_DOWN, or UNKNOWN.

On iOS and Windows, returns the current orientation of the device, regardless of the window orientation. To determine the current window orientation, use orientation.

To set the allowable orientations for a window, see orientationModes.

properties.name: portrait
properties.summary: Indicates if the device is currently held in portrait form.
properties.description: Value is true if in portrait, and false otherwise.
